text: Math 257/316 Practice questions Question 1 Consider the second order diﬀerential equation Ly = (x2 − 1 ) y′′ + xy′ − y = 0 (1) 1. Classify the points −∞ < x < ∞ as ordinary points, regular singular points and irregular singular points. 2. Use the appropriate series expansion about the point x = 0 to determine two independent solutions to equation (1). You only need to determine the ﬁrst three non-zero terms in each case. 3. What can you say about the minimum radius of convergence of the series solution you found in 2.? Question 2 Solve the following BVP ut(x, t) = uxx(x, t) + π2e −24π2t sin(5πx), 0 < x < 1, t > 0 u(0, t) = 0, u(1, t) = 0, t > 0 u(x, 0) = 3 sin(4πx), 0 < x < 1. Question 3 Solve the following BVP uxx + uyy = 0 for 0 < x < 1, 0 < y < π ux(0, y) = 0, ux(1, y) = cos(x) for 0 < y < π uy(x, 0) = uy(x, π) = 0 for 0 < x < 1 Question 4 Solve the following BVP: ut(x, t) = uxx(x, t) + 2t + cos(2πx), 0 < x < 1, t > 0 ux(0, t) = 0, ux(1, t) = 0, t > 0 u(x, 0) = 1 2π2 cos(2πx), 0 < x < 1 Question 5 Use the method of separation of variables to solve the following boundary value problem for an annular region: urr + 1 r ur + 1 r2 uθθ = 0, a < r < b, 0 < θ < π uθ(r, 0) = 0, uθ(r, π) = 0, u(a, θ) = 0 and u(b, θ) = cos(θ) + 1 1 Question 6 Solve the BVP; uxx(x, y) + uyy(x, y) = π2 2 (1 − 2x) cos πy 2 , 0 < x < 1, 0 < y < 2 ux(0, y) = 1 + (4 − π cosh π 2 ) cos πy 2 , 0 < y < 2 u(1, y) = 2 + (2 + cosh π 2 ) cos πy 2 , 0 < y < 2 uy(x, 0) = 0, uy(x, 2) = 0, 0 < x < 1 2
